citation.article-title: Reclassification of 'Blastobacter viscosus' 7d and 'Blastobacter aminooxidans' 14a as Xanthobacter viscosus sp. nov. and Xanthobacter aminoxidans sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Xanthobacter viscosus sp. nov.
Xanthobacter viscosus (vis.co′sus. L. masc. adj. viscosus sticky).
Gram-negative pleomorphic, often bent and occasionally branched rods, 0·5–0·9×1·0–3·2 μm.
Non-motile.
Reproduction occurs by asymmetric division (budding) of the mother cell to produce a shorter daughter cell.
A capsule is formed, but not rosettes.
Colonies are yellow, round, convex and of slimy consistency.
In liquid medium with methanol or glucose, growth occurs as turbidity, finally with a slimy sediment.
An exopolysaccharide consisting of galactose, glucose, rhamnose, xylose and glucuronic acid is formed.
The temperature range is 5–34 °C, optimum 28–30 °C, and the pH range is 6·5–8·5, optimum pH 6·8–7·2.
Obligately aerobic but potentially, microaerophilic.
Catalase- and oxidase-positive.
Does not hydrolyse gelatin, starch and cellulose.
Urease, phenylalanine deaminase, arginine dihydrolase are not produced.
Indole is formed from l-tryptophan.
Reduces nitrates to nitrites.
Acid but not gas is produced from glucose and fructose.

Utilizable carbon sources are methanol, ethanol, propanol, butanol, glycerol, ribose, xylose, glucose, fructose, mannitol, sorbitol, formate, formamide, glyoxylate, pyruvate, butyrate, 2-oxoglutarate, α-ketobutyrate, fumarate, succinate, cis-aconitate.
Utilizable nitrogen sources are ammonium salts, peptone and amino acids.
Fixes N2 when grown in nitrogen-deficient media.
Grows autotrophically in an atmosphere of H2+O2+CO2 and on methanol by the key Calvin-cycle enzymes phosphoribulokinase and ribulosebisphosphate carboxylase.
The main ubiquinone is Q-10.
The major fatty acid of peptone-yeast-glucose agar-grown cells is C18 : 1 (76·0 %).
The major phospholipids are phosphatidylcholine, phosphatidylglycerol and phosphatidylethanolamine.
The G+C content of the DNA is 66·3 mol% (Tm).

The GenBank accession number for the 16S rRNA gene sequence of strain 7dT is AF399970. X. viscosus strain 7dT was isolated from activated sludge of a sewage purification system of the Baikal paper mill (Russia).
The type strain, 7dT, is deposited in the All-Russian Collection of Microorganisms as VKM B-2253T and the American Type Culture Collection as ATCC BAA-298T.
